small.</h3> <a data-event-property="storage top CTA" data-event="pricingdetails-clicked-primarycta" href="https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/free/" class="wa-button wa-button-primary" icon-l"><svg><use xlink:href="#storage" viewBox="0 0 67.019 57.145"></use></svg></span> </div> </section> <section class="wa-section wa-section-mini wa-section-W06"> <div class="wa-content wa-content-4up"> <h2>How Azure pricing works</h2> <div class="wa-spacer"> <ul class="wa-checkList wa-checkList- wa-checkList-green-white"> <li><strong>No</strong> upfront cost</li> </ul> </div> <div class="wa-spacer"> <ul class="wa-checkList wa-checkList wa-checkList-green-white"> <li><strong>No</strong> termination fees</li> </ul> </div> <div class="wa-spacer"> <ul class="wa-checkList wa-checkList wa-checkList-green-white"> <li>Pay only for what you use</li> </ul> </div> </div> <div class="wa-content wa-content-micro wa-content-divided"> <a href="https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/pricing/" class="wa-arrowLink wa-arrowLink-light" ms.pgarea="content" ms.cmpgrp="body" ms.cmptyp="link" ms.cmpnm="Learn more about Azure pricing" ms.title="" ms.interactiontype="1">Learn more about Azure pricing</a> </div> </section> <section class="wa-section"> <div class="wa-content"> <div class="wa-notification"> <span class="wa-iconBoxed"><span class="icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#notification" viewBox="-2 -1 35 35"></use></svg></span></span> <p>Earn discounts on Azure services with a prepaid 12-month subscription. <a href="https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/offers/ms-azr-0026p/" ms.pgarea="content" ms.cmpgrp="body" ms.cmptyp="link" ms.cmpnm="Learn more" ms.title="" ms.interactiontype="1">Learn more</a>.</p> </div> </div> <div class="wa-content"> <p>Azure has five types of storage—Blobs, Files, Disks, Tables and Queues. <a href="https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/storage-introduction/" ms.pgarea="content" ms.cmpgrp="body" ms.cmptyp="link" ms.cmpnm="See how they work" ms.title="" ms.interactiontype="1">See how they work</a></p> <p>Your total cost depends on how much you store, the volume and type of storage transactions and <a href="https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/pricing/details/data-transfers/" ms.pgarea="content" ms.cmpgrp="body" ms.cmptyp="link" ms.cmpnm="outbound data transfers" ms.title="" ms.interactiontype="1">outbound data transfers</a>, and which data redundancy option you choose. Here’s how they compare:</p> </div> <div class="wa-content"> <table> <thead> <tr> <th>Locally Redundant Storage (LRS)</th> <th>Zone Redundant Storage (ZRS)</th> <th>Geographically Redundant Storage (GRS)</th> <th>Read-Access Geographically Redundant Storage (RA-GRS)</th> </tr> </thead> <tbody> <tr> <td>Makes multiple synchronous copies of your data within a single datacenter</td> <td>Stores three copies of data across multiple datacenters within or across regions. For block blobs only.</td> <td>Same as LRS, plus multiple asynchronous copies to a second datacenter hundreds of miles away</td> <td>Same as GRS, plus read access to the secondary datacenter</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <p>For more details on redundancy options and how they can be used for high availability, please refer to <a href="https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/storage-redundancy/" ms.pgarea="content" ms.cmpgrp="body" ms.cmptyp="link" ms.cmpnm="Azure Storage replication page" ms.title="" ms.interactiontype="1">Azure Storage replication page</a>. Please note that not all redundancy types are available for all storage types.</p> </div> <div class="wa-content"> <p>To see the pricing details for each storage type, please click on the tabs below.</p> <ul class="wa-tabs wa-tabsBlock" data-control="tabs" data-tab-panel="tabs-storage"> <li><a class="wa-tab active" data-slug="blob-storage" data-id="1" ms.pgarea="content" ms.cmpgrp="body" ms.cmptyp="tab" ms.cmpnm="Blob Storage" ms.title="" ms.interactiontype="14">Blob Storage</a></li> <li><a class="wa-tab" data-slug="file-storage" data-id="2" ms.pgarea="content" ms.cmpgrp="body" ms.cmptyp="tab" ms.cmpnm="File Storage" ms.title="" ms.interactiontype="14">File Storage</a></li> <li><a class="wa-tab" data-slug="disk-storage" data-id="3" ms.pgarea="content" ms.cmpgrp="body" ms.cmptyp="tab" ms.cmpnm="Disk Storage" ms.title="" ms.interactiontype="14">Disk Storage</a></li> <li><a class="wa-tab" data-slug="table-storage" data-id="4" ms.pgarea="content" ms.cmpgrp="body" ms.cmptyp="tab" ms.cmpnm="Table Storage" ms.title="" ms.interactiontype="14">Table Storage</a></li> <li><a class="wa-tab" data-slug="queue-storage" data-id="5" ms.pgarea="content" ms.cmpgrp="body" ms.cmptyp="tab" ms.cmpnm="Queue Storage" ms.title="" ms.interactiontype="14">Queue Storage</a></li> </ul> <div class="wa-dropdownList"> <div> <label for="wa-dropdown-region">Region:</label> <div class="wa-dropdown-container wa-dropdown-medium"> <select data-dropdown-event="pricingdetails-changed-regiondropdown" id="wa-dropdown-region" class="wa-dropdown wa-dropdown-region" data-control="dropdown"> <option class="" value="us-central"> Central US </option> <option class="" value="us-east"> East US </option> <option class="" value="us-east-2"> East US 2 </option> <option value="canada-central"> Canada Central </option> <option class="" value="canada-east"> Canada East </option> </select> <span class="wa-dropdown-value"> Central US </span> <span (£)</option> <option value="DKK">Danish Krone (kr)</option> <option value="EUR">Euro (€)</option> <option value="NOK">Norwegian Krone (kr)</option> <option value="SEK">Swedish Krona (kr)</option> value="MYR">Malaysian Ringgit (RM$)</option> </select> <span class="wa-dropdown-value">US Dollar ($)</span> <span class="wa-dropdown-arrow"></span> </div> </div> </div> <div class="wa-content wa-conditionalDisplay" data-condition-region="usgov-virginia"> <div class="wa-notification"> <span class="wa-iconBoxed"><span class="icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#notification" viewBox="-2 -1 35 35"></use></svg></span></span> <p>For Azure Government pricing information, contact your Microsoft representative or reseller.</p> </div> </div> <div class="wa-content wa-conditionalDisplay" data-condition-region="usgov-iowa"> <div class="wa-notification"> <span class="wa-iconBoxed"><span class="icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#notification" viewBox="-2 -1 35 35"></use></svg></span></span> <p>For Azure Government pricing information, contact your Microsoft representative or reseller.</p> </div> </div> <div class="wa-notification wa-conditionalDisplay" data-condition-region="australia-east australia-southeast"> <span class="wa-iconBoxed"><span class="icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#notification" viewBox="-2 -1 35 35"></use></svg></span></span> <p>The Australia Regions are available to customers with a business presence in Australia or New Zealand.</p> </div> <div class="wa-notification wa-conditionalDisplay" data-condition-region="central-india west-india south-india"> <span class="wa-iconBoxed"><span class="icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#notification" viewBox="-2 -1 35 35"></use></svg></span></span> <p>The India regions are currently available to volume licensing customers and partners with a local enrollment in India. For more information, contact your Microsoft India partner manager or account manager. The India regions will open to direct online Azure subscriptions in 2016.</p> </div> <div class="wa-conditionalDisplay active" data-condition-region="us-east us-west us-north-central us-south-central europe-north europe-west asia-pacific-southeast asia-pacific-east japan-east japan-west brazil-south us-east-2 us-central australia-east australia-southeast canada-east canada-central"> <div class="wa-notification wa-conditionalDisplay" data-condition-currency="BRL"> <span class="wa-iconBoxed"><span class="icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#notification" viewBox="-2 -1 35 35"></use></svg></span></span> <p>Important: The price in R$ is merely a reference; this is an int'l transaction and the final price is subject to exchange rates and the inclusion of IOF taxes and an eNF will not be issued.</p> </div> </div> </div> <div class="wa-content wa-tabs-container wa-conditionalDisplay active" data-tab-panel-id="tabs-storage" data-condition-region="us-east us-west us-north-central us-south-central europe-north europe-west asia-pacific-southeast asia-pacific-east japan-east japan-west brazil-south us-east-2 us-central australia-east australia-southeast canada-east canada-central"> <div class="active"> <div class="wa-conditionalDisplay active" data-condition-region="us-north-central us-south-central europe-north europe-west asia-pacific-southeast asia-pacific-east japan-east japan-west us-east-2 us-central australia-east canada-east canada-central"> <h2>Blob Storage Accounts</h2> <h3>Block blobs</h3> <p>Block Blob storage is used for streaming and storing documents, videos, pictures, backups, and other unstructured text or binary data. Below is the pricing for dedicated Blob storage accounts with Hot and Cool access tiers. Append Blobs are also metered as Block Blobs</p> <p> <a class="wa-arrowLink" href="https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/storage-introduction/" ms.pgarea="content" ms.cmpgrp="body" ms.cmptyp="link" ms.cmpnm="Learn more" ms.title="" ms.interactiontype="1">Learn more</a> </p> <h4>Storage Prices</h4> <p>These are the costs of storing your data in Block Blobs. The prices shown below are the monthly charges per GB of data stored. These prices vary based on the access tier of Block Blob storage (Hot or Cool) and the redundancy option that you choose, as well as the amount of data you store.</p> <table> <thead> <tr> <th rowspan="2"></th> <th colspan="2">LRS</th> <th colspan="2">GRS</th> <th colspan="2">RA-GRS</th> </tr> <tr> <th>Cool</th> <th>Hot</th> <th>Cool</th> <th>Hot</th> <th>Cool</th> <th>Hot</th> </tr> retrieving data from or writing data into your Block Blobs. </div> <div class="wa-conditionalDisplay" data-condition-region="us-east us-west brazil-south australia-southeast"> <div class="wa-notification"> <span class="wa-iconBoxed"> <span class="icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#notification" viewBox="-2 -1 35 35"></use></svg></span> </span> <p>Blob storage accounts with Hot and Cool access tiers are not available in this region yet, but will be coming soon. Please see below for pricing of Block blobs in general purpose storage accounts in this region.</p> </div> <div class="wa-content"> <h3>Block blobs</h3> <p>Block Blob storage is used for streaming and storing documents, videos, pictures, backups, and other unstructured text or binary data. Append Blobs are also metered as Block Blobs.</p> <p><a class="wa-arrowLink" href="https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/storage-introduction/" ms.pgarea="content" ms.cmpgrp="body" per GB</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <h4>Access Prices</h4> <p>We charge <span class="price-data " data-amount="0.0036">$0.0036</span> per 100,000 transactions for Block Blobs. Transactions include both read and write operations to storage.</p> </div> </div> </div> <div> <h3>File Storage</h3> <p>File Storage is now generally available. It uses industry standard SMB 3.0 protocol. Share files between applications running in your virtual machines using familiar Windows APIs or File REST API. </p> <p> <a class="wa-arrowLink" href="http://blogs.msdn.com/b/windowsazurestorage/archive/2014/05/12/introducing-microsoft-azure-file-service.aspx" ms.pgarea="content" ms.cmpgrp="body" ms.cmptyp="link" ms.cmpnm="Learn more" ms.title="" ms.interactiontype="1">Learn more</a> </p> <h4>Storage Prices</h4> <p>The per GB prices below will be effective starting June 1, 2016.</p> <table> <thead> <tr> <th>LRS</th> <th>GRS</th> </tr> </thead> <tbody> <tr> <td><span class="price-data " data-amount="{&quot;default&quot;:0.08,&quot;regional&quot;:{&quot;australia-east&quot;:0.088,&quot;australia-southeast&quot;:0.088,&quot;brazil-south&quot;:0.109,&quot;canada-central&quot;:0.096,&quot;canada-east&quot;:0.088,&quot;central-india&quot;:0.088,&quot;south-india&quot;:0.0792,&quot;usgov-iowa&quot;:0.1,&quot;usgov-virginia&quot;:0.1,&quot;west-india&quot;:0.1012}}">$0.08</span> per GB</td> <td><span class="price-data " data-amount="{&quot;default&quot;:0.1,&quot;regional&quot;:{&quot;australia-east&quot;:0.11,&quot;australia-southeast&quot;:0.11,&quot;brazil-south&quot;:0.136,&quot;canada-central&quot;:0.12,&quot;canada-east&quot;:0.11,&quot;central-india&quot;:0.11,&quot;south-india&quot;:0.099,&quot;usgov-iowa&quot;:0.125,&quot;usgov-virginia&quot;:0.125,&quot;west-india&quot;:0.1265}}">$0.10</span> per GB</td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <h4>Access Prices</h4> These are the costs of HTTP operations against your File data. Access prices shown below will be effective starting August 1, 2016. The promotional price of <span class="price-data " data-amount="0.0036">$0.0036</span> per 100,000 transactions will be applied through July 31, 2016. <table> <thead> <tr> <th></th> <th>LRS</th> <th>GRS</th> </tr> </thead> <tbody> <tr> <td>Put, Create Container Operations (per 100,000)</td> <td><span class="price-data " data-amount="0.15">$0.15</span></td> <td><span class="price-data " data-amount="0.3">$0.30</span></td> </tr> <tr> <td>List Operations (per 100,000)</td> <td><span class="price-data " data-amount="0.15">$0.15</span></td> <td><span class="price-data " data-amount="0.15">$0.15</span></td> </tr> <tr> <td>All other operations except Delete, which is free (per 100,000)</td> <td><span class="price-data " data-amount="0.015">$0.015</span></td> <td><span class="price-data " data-amount="0.015">$0.015</span></td> </tr> </tbody> </table> </div> <div> <h3>Disks Storage</h3> <p>Disks are used by Azure Virtual Machines for persistent storage of data. You can use multiple Disks with each Virtual Machine. Disk pricing also applies to Page blobs in general purpose storage accounts. For object storage, Block Blobs is recommended, while Page Blobs should be used only when random write operations are required.</p> <p> <a href="https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/storage-introduction/" class="wa-arrowLink" ms.pgarea="content" ms.cmpgrp="body" ms.cmptyp="link" ms.cmpnm="Learn more" ms.title="" ms.interactiontype="1">Learn more</a> </p> <h2>Premium Disks</h2> <p>Premium Storage is high performance Solid State Drive (SSD) based Storage designed to support I/O intensive workloads with significantly high throughput and low latency. With Premium Storage, you can provision a persistent disk and configure its size and performance characteristics to meet your application requirements.</p> <div class="wa-conditionalDisplay active" data-condition-region="us-east us-west us-south-central europe-north europe-west asia-pacific-southeast asia-pacific-east japan-east japan-west us-east-2 us-central australia-east australia-southeast canada-east canada-central"> <p>Premium Disks are currently offered in three disk sizes: P10 (128 GB), P20 (512 GB) and P30 (1,024 GB). These disk sizes provide different input/output operations per sec (IOPs), throughput caps and monthly price per GB, offering simplicity and better price predictability. You choose the option which best meets your required storage size, IOPs, and throughput for your applications. You can attach several persistent disks to a VM and configure up to 64 TB of storage per VM, and achieve 80,000 (input/output operations per second) and 1600 MB per second disk throughput per VM at less than one millisecond latency for read operations. Premium Storage is supported by a new a variant of the D-series and G-series sizes called “DS” and “GS” respectively, which are specifically targeted for Premium Storage. The pricing and billing meters for the DS sizes are the same as D-series and the GS sizes are the same as G-series.</p> <p>Snapshots are charged at <span class="price-data " data-amount="{&quot;default&quot;:0.12,&quot;regional&quot;:{&quot;asia-pacific-east&quot;:0.145,&quot;asia-pacific-southeast&quot;:0.132,&quot;australia-east&quot;:0.132,&quot;australia-southeast&quot;:0.132,&quot;canada-central&quot;:0.144,&quot;canada-east&quot;:0.132,&quot;central-india&quot;:0.13,&quot;south-india&quot;:0.1188,&quot;europe-north&quot;:0.132,&quot;europe-west&quot;:0.145,&quot;japan-east&quot;:0.152,&quot;japan-west&quot;:0.138,&quot;us-central&quot;:0.132,&quot;us-east-2&quot;:0.12,&quot;usgov-iowa&quot;:0.132,&quot;usgov-virginia&quot;:0.132,&quot;us-west&quot;:0.132}}">$0.132</span>/GB per month.</p> <table> <thead> <tr> <th>Disk Types</th> <th>P10</th> <th>P20</th> <th>P30</th> </tr> </thead> <tbody> <tr> <td>Disk Size</td> <td>128 GB</td> <td>512 GB</td> <td>1,024 GB</td> </tr> Standard Disks &amp; Page Blobs. Transactions include both read and write operations to storage.</p> </div> <div> <h3>Tables</h3> <p>Tables offer NoSQL storage for unstructured and semi-structured data—ideal for web applications, address books, and other user data.</p> <p> <a href="https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/storage-introduction/" class="wa-arrowLink" ms.pgarea="content" ms.cmpgrp="body" Queues. drives. <a href="https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/pricing/details/storage-import-export/" ms.pgarea="content" ms.cmpgrp="body" ms.cmptyp="link" ms.cmpnm="Learn more" ms.title="" ms.interactiontype="1">Learn more</a></p> </div> <div class="wa-content"> <h3>Support &amp; SLA</h3> <ul> <li>Free billing and subscription management support.</li> <li>Flexible support plans starting at <span class="price-data " data-amount="{&quot;currencies&quot;:{&quot;USD&quot;:29.0,&quot;ARS&quot;:450.0,&quot;AUD&quot;:40.0,&quot;BRL&quot;:110.0,&quot;CAD&quot;:40.0,&quot;CHF&quot;:30.0,&quot;DKK&quot;:200.0,&quot;EUR&quot;:25.0,&quot;GBP&quot;:20.0,&quot;HKD&quot;:250.0,&quot;IDR&quot;:430000.0,&quot;INR&quot;:1800.0,&quot;JPY&quot;:3000.0,&quot;KRW&quot;:34800.0,&quot;MXN&quot;:600.0,&quot;MYR&quot;:150.0,&quot;NOK&quot;:250.0,&quot;NZD&quot;:50.0,&quot;RUB&quot;:1900.0,&quot;SAR&quot;:110.0,&quot;SEK&quot;:250.0,&quot;TRY&quot;:90.0,&quot;TWD&quot;:900.0,&quot;ZAR&quot;:500.0}}" data-decimals="0">$29</span>/month. <a href="https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/support/plans/" ms.pgarea="content" ms.cmpgrp="body" ms.cmptyp="link" ms.cmpnm="Shop for a plan" ms.title="" ms.interactiontype="1">Shop for a plan</a></li> <li>Guaranteed 99.9% or greater availability (excludes preview services). <a href="https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/support/legal/sla/storage/" ms.pgarea="content" ms.cmpgrp="body" ms.cmptyp="link" ms.cmpnm="Read the SLA" ms.title="" ms.interactiontype="1"> Read the SLA</a></li> </ul> </div> <div class="wa-content"> <div class="wa-faq-expandAll" data-faq="faq"> <a href="https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/pricing/details/storage/#" class="expand" ms.pgarea="content" ms.cmpgrp="body" ms.cmptyp="link" ms.cmpnm="Expand All" ms.title="" ms.interactiontype="1">Expand All</a> <a href="https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/pricing/details/storage/#" class="collapse" ms.pgarea="content" ms.cmpgrp="body" ms.cmptyp="link" ms.cmpnm="Collapse All" ms.title="" ms.interactiontype="1">Collapse All</a> </div> </div> <div class="wa-content wa-content-micro"> <h2>FAQ</h2> <h3>General</h3> <ul class="wa-faq" data-faq="faq"> <li class="wa-faq-question"> <a href="https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/pricing/details/storage/#" ms.pgarea="content" ms.cmpgrp="body" ms.cmptyp="faq question link" ms.cmpnm="If I use Storage for only a few days a month, is the cost prorated?" ms.title="" ms.interactiontype="14">If I use Storage for only a few days a month, is the cost prorated?</a> <div class="wa-faq-answer"> <p>Yes. Storage capacity is billed in units of the average daily amount of data stored, in gigabytes (GB), over a monthly period. For example, if you consistently utilized 10 GB of storage for the first half of the month and none for the second half of the month, you would be billed for your average usage of 5 GB of storage.</p> </div> </li> <li class="wa-faq-question"> <a href="https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/pricing/details/storage/#" ms.pgarea="content" ms.cmpgrp="body" ms.cmptyp="faq question link" ms.cmpnm="How do I know which data redundancy option (LRS, GRS, RA-GRS) I’m using?" ms.title="" ms.interactiontype="14">How do I know which data redundancy option (LRS, GRS, RA-GRS) I’m using?</a> <div class="wa-faq-answer"> <p>Storage accounts by default are set up to be geographically redundant. You can change these setting to read-access geographically redundant or locally redundant through the Microsoft Azure classic portal or the service management API. You can also check the status on the portal on using the service management API.</p> </div> </li> <li class="wa-faq-question"> <a href="https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/pricing/details/storage/#" ms.pgarea="content" ms.cmpgrp="body" ms.cmptyp="faq question link" ms.cmpnm="How does RA-GRS billing work?" ms.title="" ms.interactiontype="14">How does RA-GRS billing work?</a> <div class="wa-faq-answer"> <p>Storage accounts will be charged for a minimum of 30 days from the time the service is enabled. For example, if RA-GRS is turned on May 1 and turned off May 5, the storage account will be charged for RA-GRS through May 30. After that, GRS pricing would start.</p> <p>If RA-GRS is turned on May 1 and turned off June 14, RA-GRS would be charged through June 14. On June 15, GRS pricing would take effect.</p> </div> </li> </ul> <h3>Blob Storage</h3> <ul class="wa-faq" data-faq="faq"> <li class="wa-faq-question"> <a href="https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/pricing/details/storage/#" ms.pgarea="content" ms.cmpgrp="body" ms.cmptyp="faq question link" ms.cmpnm="What is a Blob Storage Account and how is it different from a general purpose Storage Account?" ms.title="" ms.interactiontype="14">What is a Blob Storage Account and how is it different from a general purpose Storage Account?</a> <div class="wa-faq-answer"> <p>Blob Storage Account is a storage account specialized for storing data as blobs and allows users to specify an access tier based on the frequency of access for the data in that account. General purpose storage accounts can be used to store Blobs as well as Files, Disks, Tables, Queues.</p> </div> </li> <li class="wa-faq-question"> <a href="https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/pricing/details/storage/#" ms.pgarea="content" ms.cmpgrp="body" ms.cmptyp="faq question link" ms.cmpnm="Have the prices of Block Blobs in general purpose Storage Accounts changed?" ms.title="" ms.interactiontype="14">Have the prices of Block Blobs in general purpose Storage Accounts changed?</a> <div class="wa-faq-answer"> <p>No. Block Blob prices in general purpose Storage Account have NOT changed and can be seen <a href="https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/pricing/details/storage/blob/" ms.pgarea="content" ms.cmpgrp="body" ms.cmptyp="faq link" ms.cmpnm="here" ms.title="" ms.interactiontype="1">here</a>.</p> </div> </li> <li class="wa-faq-question"> <a href="https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/pricing/details/storage/#" ms.pgarea="content" ms.cmpgrp="body" ms.cmptyp="faq question link" ms.cmpnm="When looking at my Azure bill, how can I tell whether I am being charged for Blob Storage Account or Blobs in general purpose Storage Accounts?" ms.title="" ms.interactiontype="14">When looking at my Azure bill, how can I tell whether I am being charged for Blob Storage Account or Blobs in general purpose Storage Accounts?</a> <div class="wa-faq-answer"> <p>If you see “Hot” or “Cool” in the resource name, it means that the charge is associated with Blob Storage Accounts. For example, when you see “Standard IO - Cool Block Blob (GB)” in your bill, it means you are using and being charged for Blob Storage Accounts, while “Standard IO – Block Blob (GB)” is the meter associated with use of Block Blobs in general purpose Storage accounts.</p> </div> </li> <li class="wa-faq-question"> <a href="https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/pricing/details/storage/#" ms.pgarea="content" ms.cmpgrp="body" ms.cmptyp="faq question link" ms.cmpnm="What are Hot and Cool access tiers and how should I determine which one to use?" ms.title="" ms.interactiontype="14">What are Hot and Cool access tiers and how should I determine which one to use?</a> <div class="wa-faq-answer"> <p>When you create a Blob Storage Account, you can set the access tier as Cool or Hot. Cool tier has lower cost of storing data but higher cost of accessing data and it should be used for data that is not frequently accessed and has lower availability SLA requirements. If you do not know the access pattern for your data, we recommend that you start with the Hot tier for at least a month and then determine whether you can save costs by moving to Cool storage based on your actual usage. Below you can see an example.</p> <p>Example: You have 50TB of data that you want to store in Blob Storage in US East 2 region. You send 10M HTTP operations to the account every month, 20% of which are Put Blob/Block, List and Create Container operations. You read 20TB of data from account every month, and write 10TB of data. This is how your total cost will be calculated in Hot vs. Cool.</p> <table> <thead> <tr> <th>Unit of Measure</th> <th>Usage volume</th> <th>Price in Cool</th> <th>Price in Hot</th> <th>Monthly cost in Cool</th> <th>Monthly cost in Hot</th> </tr> </thead> <tbody> <tr> <td>GB per month</td> <td>50*1,024= 51,200</td> <td><span class="price-data " data-amount="0.01">$0.01</span></td> <td><span class="price-data " data-amount="0.024">$0.024</span></td> <td><span class="price-data " data-amount="512.0">$512</span></td> <td><span class="price-data " data-amount="1228.8">$1,228.80</span></td> </tr> <tr> <td>10,000 Put Blob/Block, List, Create Container Operations</td> <td>20% * 10M /10,000 = 200</td> <td><span class="price-data " data-amount="0.1">$0.10</span></td> <td><span class="price-data " data-amount="0.05">$0.05</span></td> <td><span class="price-data " data-amount="20.0">$20</span></td> <td><span class="price-data " data-amount="10.0">$10</span></td> </tr> <tr> <td>10,000 Operations, others</td> <td>80% * 10M /10,000 = 800</td> <td><span class="price-data " data-amount="0.01">$0.01</span></td> <td><span class="price-data " data-amount="0.004">$0.004</span></td> <td><span class="price-data " data-amount="8.0">$8</span></td> <td><span class="price-data " data-amount="3.2">$3.20</span></td> </tr> <tr> <td>GB of Data Retrieved</td> <td>20 * 1,024 = 20,480</td> <td><span class="price-data " data-amount="0.01">$0.01</span></td> <td><span class="price-data " data-amount="0.0">$0</span></td> <td><span class="price-data " data-amount="204.8">$204.80</span></td> <td><span class="price-data " data-amount="0.0">$0</span></td> </tr> <tr> <td>GB of Data Written</td> <td>10 * 1,024 = 10,240</td> <td><span class="price-data " data-amount="0.0025">$0.0025</span></td> <td><span class="price-data " data-amount="0.0">$0</span></td> <td><span class="price-data " data-amount="25.6">$25.60</span></td> <td><span class="price-data " data-amount="0.0">$0</span></td> </tr> </tbody> <tfoot> <tr> <td colspan="4" class="text-bold">Total Monthly Cost</td> <td><span class="price-data " data-amount="770.4">$770.40</span></td> <td><span class="price-data " data-amount="1242.0">$1,242</span></td> </tr> </tfoot> </table> <p>In this example, the total monthly cost of Cool tier adds up to <span class="price-data " data-amount="770.4">$770.40</span> vs <span class="price-data " data-amount="1242.0">$1,242</span> in Hot tier. You will realize substantial cost savings by moving your data to the Cool tier in this example.</p><p> </p></div> </li> <li class="wa-faq-question"> <a href="https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/pricing/details/storage/#" ms.pgarea="content" ms.cmpgrp="body" ms.cmptyp="faq question link" ms.cmpnm="Do I get charged for Data Retrieval if I toggle my Blob Storage Account from Cool to Hot?" ms.title="" ms.interactiontype="14">Do I get charged for Data Retrieval if I toggle my Blob Storage Account from Cool to Hot?</a> <div class="wa-faq-answer"> <p>You will be charged for Data Retrieval when you toggle your Blob Storage Account from Cool to Hot – for Example if you have 100 GB of data in a Blob Storage Account and you toggle that account from Cool to Hot, you will be charged 100 * <span class="price-data " data-amount="0.01">$0.01</span> = <span class="price-data " data-amount="1.0">$1</span> for Data Retrieval.</p> </div> </li> <li class="wa-faq-question"> <a href="https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/pricing/details/storage/#" ms.pgarea="content" ms.cmpgrp="body" ms.cmptyp="faq question link" ms.cmpnm="Do I get charged for Data Writes if I toggle my Blob Storage Account from Hot to Cool?" ms.title="" ms.interactiontype="14">Do I get charged for Data Writes if I toggle my Blob Storage Account from Hot to Cool?</a> <div class="wa-faq-answer"> <p>No – If you toggle your account from Hot to Cool, you will not be charged for Data Writes. You only get charged for Data Writes if you directly write data to your Blob Storage Account with Cool access tiers.</p> </div> </li> <li class="wa-faq-question"> <a href="https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/pricing/details/storage/#" ms.pgarea="content" ms.cmpgrp="body" ms.cmptyp="faq question link" ms.cmpnm="What is Geo-Replication Data Transfer Charge?" ms.title="" ms.interactiontype="14">What is Geo-Replication Data Transfer Charge?</a> <div class="wa-faq-answer"> <p>When you write data into GRS accounts, that data will be replicated to another Azure region. The Geo-Replication Data Transfer charge is the bandwidth cost of replicating that data to another Azure region.</p> </div> </li> </ul> <h3>Disk Storage</h3> <ul class="wa-faq" data-faq="faq"> <li class="wa-faq-question"> <a href="https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/pricing/details/storage/#" ms.pgarea="content" ms.cmpgrp="body" ms.cmptyp="faq question link" ms.cmpnm="If I attach an empty 100GB disk to my virtual machine, will I be charged for the entire 100 GB or just the storage space I use?" ms.title="" ms.interactiontype="14">If I attach an empty 100GB disk to my virtual machine, will I be charged for the entire 100 GB or just the storage space I use?</a> <div class="wa-faq-answer"> <p>If the empty 100GB disk is backed by a Premium Storage Account then you will be charged for a P0 (128GB) disk. If any other type of Storage Account is used then you’ll only be billed for the storage space used to store the data that is written to the disk regardless of the allocated disk size.</p> </div> </li> <li class="wa-faq-question"> <a href="https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/pricing/details/storage/#" ms.pgarea="content" ms.cmpgrp="body" ms.cmptyp="faq question link" ms.cmpnm="Is Premium Storage covered under the same SLA as other storage services?" ms.title="" ms.interactiontype="14">Is Premium Storage covered under the same SLA as other storage services?</a> <div class="wa-faq-answer"> <p>Yes. 99.9% read/write availability also applies to Premium Storage accounts. </p> </div> </li> </ul> </div> <div class="wa-content"> <h3>Resources</h3> <div class="wa-resourceBlockRow"> <a href="https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/pricing/calculator/?service=storage" class="wa-resourceBlock" ms.pgarea="content" ms.cmpgrp="body" ms.cmptyp="resource block link" ms.cmpnm="Calculator Estimate your monthly costs for Azure services" ms.title="" ms.interactiontype="1"> <span class="wa-resourceBlock-header">Calculator</span> Estimate your monthly costs for Azure services </a> <a href="https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/pricing/faq/" class="wa-resourceBlock" ms.pgarea="content" ms.cmpgrp="body" ms.cmptyp="resource block link" ms.cmpnm="Purchase FAQ Review Azure pricing frequently asked questions" ms.title="" ms.interactiontype="1"> <span class="wa-resourceBlock-header">Purchase FAQ</span> Review Azure pricing frequently asked questions </a> <a href="https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/services/storage/" class="wa-resourceBlock" ms.pgarea="content" ms.cmpgrp="body" ms.cmptyp="resource block link" ms.cmpnm="Service Details Learn more about Storage" ms.title="" ms.interactiontype="1"> <span class="wa-resourceBlock-header">Service Details</span> Learn more about Storage </a> <a href="https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/services/storage/" class="wa-resourceBlock" ms.pgarea="content" ms.cmpgrp="body" ms.cmptyp="resource block link" ms.cmpnm="Documentation Review technical tutorials, videos and more resources" ms.title="" ms.interactiontype="1"> <span class="wa-resourceBlock-header">Documentation</span> Review technical tutorials, videos and more resources </div> <div class="column medium-4"> <div class="wa-dropdownList"> <div> <div id="dropdown-cultures" class="wa-dropdown-container wa-dropdown-container-dark"> <select class="wa-dropdown" data-control="dropdown"> <option value="en-us" selected="&#39;selected&#39;">English (US)</option> <option value="cs-cz">Čeština</option> <option value="da-dk">Dansk</option> <option class="wa-dropdown wa-dropdown-currency" data-control="dropdown"> <option value="USD" selected="&#39;selected&#39;">US Dollar ($)</option> <option value="EUR">Euro (€)</option> <option value="ZAR">South African Rand (R)</option> <option value="SEK">Swedish Krona (kr)</option> <option value="TWD">Taiwanese Dollar (NT$)</option> <option value="TRY">Turkish Lira (TL)</option> <option
